trial_identification.studytitle: Protective Manual Hyperinflation in Acute Mechanically Ventilated Trauma Patients
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of Protective Manual Hyperinflation With Current Methods in Ventilated Acute Trauma Patients: a Randomized Controlled Trial

conditions.healthcondition: Critically Injured Mechanically Ventilated Trauma Patients

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - Protective manual hyperinflation Other interventions - Usual method of MHI
Active Comparator: Usual method of MHI -
Experimental: Protective MHI -
Other interventions: Protective manual hyperinflation Manual hyperinflation for 10 minutes using a Mapleson C circuit and 100% oxygen with volume set at 8mls/kg and positive end expiratory pressure in the circuit appropriate to baseline levels
Other interventions: Usual method of MHI Manual hyperinflation for 10 minutes using a Mapleson C circuit and 100% oxygen with volume set at 12mls/kg and no positive end expiratory pressure in the circuit

primaryOutcome.outcome: Interleukin 6 - 5 mls of arterial blood will be colected in an EDTA tube, centrifuged and aliquoted within 30 minutes. It will be stored at -80 degrees C and the analysis completed in batches by enzyme linked immunosorbent assay
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Change between Baseline and 40 minutes and 70 minutes post baseline

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Tumour necrosis factor alpha - 5 mls of arterial blood will be colected in an EDTA tube, centrifuged and aliquoted within 30 minutes. It will be stored at -80 degrees C and the analysis completed in batches by enzyme linked immunosorbent assay
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change from Baseline to 40 minutes and 70 minutes post baseline

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Interleukin 1-beta - 5 mls of arterial blood will be colected in an EDTA tube, centrifuged and aliquoted within 30 minutes. It will be stored at -80 degrees C and the analysis completed in batches by enzyme linked immunosorbent assay
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change between baseline and 40 minutes and 70 minutes post baseline

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Interleukin 8 - 5 mls of arterial blood will be colected in an EDTA tube, centrifuged and aliquoted within 30 minutes. It will be stored at -80 degrees C and the analysis completed in batches by enzyme linked immunosorbent assay
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change between baseline and 40 minutes and 70 minutes post baseline

secondaryOutcome.outcome: PaO2/FiO2 Oxygenation ratio - The ratio between the partial pressure of oxygen in arterial blood and the fraction of inspired oxygen which is delivered to the patient.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Chnge between baseline and 15 minutes and 40 minutes post baseline

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Static lung compliance - Static lung compliance is the change in volume for any given applied pressure. The formula is Compliance = Change in volume/change in pleural pressure. An inspiratory hold will be dialled on the mechanical ventilator and the static lung compliance value will be recorded from the screen.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Change between Baseline and 15 minutes and 70 minutes post baseline

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Mean arterial blood pressure - The mean blood pressure will be recorded from the arterial catheter in situ. This is displayed continuously on the Phillips Intellivue Monitor and will be recorded for the time of intervention
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: the change between baseline and every minute during intervention for 10 minutes will be compared

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Sputum volume - Sputum will be suctioned at the end of the manual hyperinflation technique by an inline suction catheter using sterile technique into a closed sample jar. This will be weighed on an Acculab Pocket Scale PP401

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Trauma patients
- Day 1 of admission to intensive care
- Mechanically ventilated
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Pre-existing lung disease
- PEEP > 12.5cmH20
- Nitric oxide in circuit
- Haemodynamically unstable
- Undrained pneumothorax
- Intracranial pressure > 25mmHg

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This single-blinded randomized study aims to compare two methods of manual hyperinflation (protective - moderate tidal volumes with positive end expiratory pressure) and non-protective (large tidal volume and no positive end expiratory pressure) in ventilated acute trauma patients, to investigate the effect on inflammatory markers, lung compliance, oxygenation and sputum volume.
